ext_descriptions.ext_description: A layer_position_type lists the types of the layer position in the sequence of layers.
specifies that the layer position is secondary, a design layer opposite that of the primary layer;
specifies that a layer may be in any sequential position;
specifies that layer position is either the primary or secondary layer;
specifies that layer position is the z-axis zero position in the vertical sequence of layers;
specifies that layer position is not one of primary or secondary;
A predefined_design_layer_purpose lists the purposes of the layer, in the context of the types of signals intended to be implemented.
specifies that layer is used for a signal other than power or ground;
specifies that layer is used for lands only;
specifies that layer is used for power or ground signals;
specifies that layer is used for an embedded passive capacitor dielectric;
specifies that layer is used for an embedded passive resistor conductor;
A predefined_documentation_layer_purpose lists the predefined purpose of the documentation layer.
specifies that documentation layer is soldermask;

ext_description.p: specifies that documentation layer is solderpaste;
ext_description.note: In the context of this part of ISO 10303, specifies that solder paste applied during an assembly manufacturing process is deposited only where there are positive regions in the model.

ext_description.p: specifies that documentation layer is silkscreen;
ext_description.note: An application of silkscreen requires a rigid surface but this part of ISO 10303 does not enforce that level of process modeling.

ext_description.p: specifies that documentation layer is generic layer;
ext_description.note: A generic_layer does not have a predefined purpose.
ext_description.example: The generic dielectric known to exist between design layers is assigned a purpose of generic_layer.

ext_description.p: specifies that documentation layer is glue;
specifies that documentation layer is gluemask;
ext_description.note: The gluemask layer is usually a negative image and requires correct interpretation by post-processors for mass property calculations of the PCA or PWA.

ext_description.p: specifies that documentation layer is pastemask;
ext_description.note: The pastemask layer is usually a negative image and requires correct interpretation by post-processors for mass property calculations of the PCA or PWA.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies that documentation layer is finish coating.

A stiffness_class specifies that the material is able to flow during the manufacturing process. The finished state is a solid.
These predefined types apply to properties of materials used in PCB/PWB and PWA/PWB domain. They are primarily used to distinguish between stages of materials that exist during the fabrication and assembly manufacturing processes and not the stages of material as delivered to a customer as part of an assembly or interconnect.
specifies that the type is B-stage or equivalent in rigidity and fluid flow with constant thickness properties under manufacturing conditions;
specifies that the type is B-stage or equivalent in rigidity and fluid flow with varying thickness properties under manufacturing conditions;
specifies that the laminate type is solid.

ext_description.p: The ft_terminus_condition lists the functional options that are available at one or both ends of a passage in an interconnect.
ext_description.note: This provides the capability to state whether a passage contacts or penetrates the stratum at the end of the passage.

The distinction between "top" and "bottom" is supported in
and is included herein for completeness.

ext_description.p: specifies that each end of the passage contacts the stratum identified as being the end of the passage but does not penetrate the stratum;
ext_description.note: In typical industrial usage bilateral_bond forms a plug instead of a passage because both ends of the passage are closed. A plug may be formed when micro-vias are stacked in the same exact location.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: that each end of the passage passes completely through the stratum identified as being the end of the passage;

ext_description.p: specifies that one end of the passage contacts the stratum identified as being that end of the passage and the other end of the passage passes completely through the stratum identified as being that end of the passage.
ext_description.example: A micro-via is an example application of a unilateral_bond.
ext_description.note: Bond in this context specifies sufficient bonding to support desired reliability of the bond formed during manufacture.

The purpose of bond in this context is to support additive technologies which partially or completely fill the passage and which bond to the target feature in the stratum that is specified as a contact stratum. The target feature in the contact stratum is not explicitly identified as a target feature to reduce model size.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A trace_class lists the possible values of the trace class.
specifies that the trace class is microstrip;
specifies that the trace class is stripline;
specifies that the trace class is co planar waveguide.

The up_or_down lists the dependencies between
members.

indicates that there is no dependency between
members;

indicates that the subsequent
is based on the precedent .

indicates that the precedent
is based on the subsequent .

An Allocated_passage_minimum_annular_ring is a type of
included to support specification of annular ring properties for the combined technology that results from applying a
to a stackup model. When associated_stratum_technology_occurrence is not provided, the interpretation shall be that the Allocated_passage_minimum_annular_ring applies to the entire design model.

specifies a role of the
for the Allocated_passage_minimum_annular_ring. The value is the minimum remaining width of the annular ring after fabrication for the case that there is plating and that the
is on an external layer. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Allocated_passage_minimum_annular_ring. The value is the minimum remaining width of the annular ring after fabrication for the case that there is plating and that the
is on an internal layer. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Allocated_passage_minimum_annular_ring. The value is the minimum remaining width of the annular ring after fabrication for the case that there will not be a connection to the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Allocated_passage_minimum_annular_ring. The value is the minimum allowance for fabrication registration errors. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Allocated_passage_minimum_annular_ring. The
specifies the combination of technologies against which the annular ring requirement is applied. There may be more than one
provided. In the case that more than one
is provided, all members of
are for the same stackup model.

specifies a role of the
for the Allocated_passage_minimum_annular_ring. The
specifies the specific layer against which the annular ring requirement is placed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the role of a
for the Allocated_passage_minimum_annular_ring. The associated_model is the stackup model for which the Allocated_passage_minimum_annular_ring provides specialized fabrication tolerances.
There shall exist a supported_external_minimum_annular_ring or a supported_internal_minimum_annular_ring or an unsupported_minimum_annular_ring or a minimum_fabrication_allowance.
The associated_stratum_technology_occurrence helps compose the stackup model indirectly specified by the associated_passage_allocation.

If supported_external_minimum_annular_ring is provided, the associated
shall be plated.

If supported_internal_minimum_annular_ring is provided, the associated
shall be plated.

The unsupported_minimum_annular_ring shall not be provided when the associated
is plated.
Each member of associated_passage_allocation shall reference the associated_model.

ext_description.p: Either associated_stratum_technology_occurrence or supported_internal_minimum_annular_ring may be provided but they shall not both be provided.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Copy_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship is a type of , stating that the geometry of the primary
is copied to the geometry of the secondary . In the case that a
is referenced by several Copy_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship as secondary, the resulting geometry is the result of applying the regularized Boolean union operator to the geometries of the primary .

ext_description.p:
A Stratum_stack_model is a type of that is included to define the sequence of materials in an interconnect. The stackup model is a representation of a graph and the represented graph has specific properties. The graph is a directed graph. The graph is acyclic with the sole exception being a single loop configuration for the situation where there is exactly one
in the model. Because the graph relates to material structures which are connected, the graph is a connected graph. The graph may have multiple roots and multiple paths from a root to a leaf element. The convention in this part of ISO 10303 is that the direction of the elements of the graph is in the negative z dimension. The stackup is devoid of any pattern information and is intended to serve as a foundational structure. A Stratum_stack_model is a .

example.p: Figure 4 in ISO/TS 10303-1737 illustrates several simple stackups for microstrip design structures. The parametric information related to the vertical extents of the elements in the illustration would be derived from the properties of the nodes of the stackup model which are . The properties of the are inherited from the in the role of definition for the . The parametric information related to the horizontal extents of the elements in the illustration is unrelated to the Stratum_stack_model.
A design stackup that includes different final finish materials in different regions on the top side will have multiple root elements and therefore multiple paths through the graph.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_stack_model. There shall exist one or more Stratum_technology_occurrences for the Stratum_stack_model.
specified by composing_occurrence help to compose a Stratum_stack_model.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Stratum_stack_model is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Stratum_stack_model as its . There shall exist one or more Stratum_technology_occurrence_relationships for the Stratum_stack_model.

ext_description.p:
Only the type
shall be a member of composing_link.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Passage_deposition_material_identification is a type of used to identify material deposited on the walls or lower or upper terminus of a passage.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Passage_deposition_material_identification. There shall exist one or more Passage_technologies for the Passage_deposition_material_identification.
A Passage_filling_material_identification is a type of used to identify material that fills a passage.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Passage_filling_material_identification. There shall exist one or more Passage_technologies for the Passage_filling_material_identification.

ext_description.p: An Inverse_copy_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship is a type of , stating that the geometry of one is an inverse copy of the geometry of another . In the case that a is specified to be inverse copies of several other members of , the derived geometry is the result of applying the regularized Boolean intersection operator to the geometries of the other strata.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Design_layer_technology is a type of . The Design_layer_technology is a technology specification tailored for those materials intended to be used to implement the direct connectivity as described in a design. The same Design_layer_technology may be used in multiple designs for multiple products, since there is no dependence of the Design_layer_technology on the design referencing it. A Design_layer_technology shall not be used for printed components as defined by
where conductivity class other than 'conductive' is required because the conductivity class of a Design_layer_technology is required to be 'conductive'.
An example where an application of Design_layer_technology is inappropriate is for paste resistors on a layer where the paste resistors are not also interconnected on that same layer since the conductivity class for a paste resistor is 'resistive'. The terminals of the paste resistors in this example would be bonded to features of a design layer during fabrication in order to realize interconnect between each other. A via may be dropped onto a paste resistor if the realization process supports it.
An example where an application of Design_layer_technology is required is for printed coils where the coil is fabricated on a signal layer.

specifies the
for the Design_layer_technology. The design_layer_purpose specifies one of the lands_only, other_signal, or power_or_ground purpose of the for the Design_layer_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Design_layer_technology is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Design_layer_technology as its . There shall be no more than one
for the Design_layer_technology.
The inherited from shall be at least one of: thermally, electrically, optically or magnetically conductive.

ext_description.p: The design_layer_purpose or externally_defined_design_layer_purpose shall exist but not both together.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Design_stack_model is a type of
that is included in a design to specify the set of laminate stackups used in the design of an interconnect. A Design_stack_model is composed of one or more
each of which may specify local stackup requirements.

specifies a role of the
for the Design_stack_model. The value of this atribute need not be specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Design_stack_model is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Design_stack_model as its . There shall exist one and more Stratum_sub_stacks for a Design_stack_model.

A Documentation_layer_technology is a type of that may have patterns applied and whose purpose is not for directly implementing point to point connectivity as in the . A Documentation_layer_technology shall be used for printed components as defined by
where conductivity class other than 'conductive' is required because the conductivity class of a Documentation_layer_technology may be something other than 'conductive'. The externally_defined_documentation_layer_purpose provides a facility to specify the detailed nature of the application. A standard external to this part of ISO 10303 or industrial exchange agreements may formalize the externally_defined_documentation_layer_purpose.
An example where an application of Documentation_layer_technology is appropriate is for paste resistors with a conductivity class of 'resistive'.
An example where an application of Documentation_layer_technology is appropriate is for paste capacitors with a conductivity class of 'non conductive'.

specifies the
to describe the purpose defined in this part of ISO 10303 for the Documentation_layer_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Documentation_layer_technology is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Documentation_layer_technology as its . There shall be no more than one
for the Documentation_layer_technology.

ext_description.p: Exactly one of pre_defined_documentation_layer_purpose, externally_defined_documentation_layer_purpose shall be provided.

An Equivalent_stackup_model_definition is a type of
and a type of
that provides support for explicitly stating that a more detailed stackup model is the topological equivalent of a more generic stackup model.
ext_description.note: A more detailed model may be desired for analysis purposes or to show how a model based requirement is implemented.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Equivalent_stackup_model_definition.

specifies a role of the
for the Equivalent_stackup_model_definition.

specifies a role of the
for the Equivalent_stackup_model_definition. There shall exist one or more Equivalent_sub_stack_definitions for the Equivalent_stackup_model_definition.
The primary_stackup_model shall not be the equivalent_stackup_model.

ext_description.p:
Each member of equivalent_sub_stacks shall specify the equivalent_stackup_model as the
for the
of that member of equivalent_sub_stacks.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The graph of instances of the Application Object Equivalent_stackup_model_definition shall not contain a cycle.

An Equivalent_sub_stack_definition is a type of
that specifies the equivalence of a subset of a more generic stackup to a subset of a more detailed stackup.

specifies the role of the
for the Equivalent_sub_stack_definition. The equivalent_stack is the more detailed stackup.

specifies the role of the
for the Equivalent_sub_stack_definition. The primary_sto is a reference in the equivalence relation.

specifies the role of the
for the Equivalent_sub_stack_definition. The primary_sto_link is the range of stackup in the more generic stackup.

ext_description.p: The primary_sto shall be referenced by the primary_sto_link.
The stackup referenced by the equivalent_stack shall not be the stackup associated with the primary_sto_link.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Default_component_termination_passage_definition is a type of
that defines a default passage based on characteristics of the associated .

specifies the role of the
for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.

specifies the role of the
for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.

specifies the role of the
for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Default_component_termination_passage_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Default_component_termination_passage_definition as its . There shall be exactly one
for a particular Default_component_termination_passage_definition.

ext_description.p: the deposition_material shall be of type .
ext_description.note:
The supertype
specifies that the deposition material shall be conductive. An application interface shall specify the domain, usually electrical.

ext_description.p:
A Default_tapered_blind_via_definition is a type of
that supports the definition of vias that have a different diameter on one end than on the other. The passage diametric extent decreases as a measurement point moves toward the interior of the interconnect.
ext_description.note: This Application Object is intended to support micro-vias where the source system has the knowledge of the change in diameter.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Default_tapered_blind_via_definition. Interior refers to the location of the smaller diameter of the passage.
The as_finished_interior_passage_extent shall be less than .

A Default_unsupported_passage_definition is a type of
where the passage is unsupported by metallization.

specifies a role of the
for the Default_unsupported_passage_definition.

ext_description.p:
A Default_via_definition is a type of
that defines the default shape of the . Mandatory properties are identified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Default_via_definition.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Default_via_definition.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Default_via_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Default_via_definition as its . There shall exist exactly one
for the Default_via_definition.

ext_description.p: The deposition_material shall be of type .
ext_description.note:
The supertype
specifies that the deposition material shall be conductive. An application interface shall specify the domain, usually electrical.

ext_description.p:
A Derived_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship is a type of
for the purpose of stating that the geometry of one
is derived from the geometry of another . The geometry of a
that references a
that is itself referenced by a Derived_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship as a secondary
is the derived geometry. A
whose geometry is derived shall not have any explicit . A
whose geometry is derived shall not have any explicit geometry. A Derived_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship is either a
or an . A
shall not be referenced by more than one type of Derived_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship as a secondary .
ext_description.note:
Primary and secondary are informal role names. The formal names are
and , respectively, and are inherited from .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Footprint_library_stratum_technology is a type of for use where generic footprint patterns are defined and where the is not applicable.

The
shall not be populated.

An Impedance_measurement_setup_requirement is a type of
that specifies the structural relationships necessary to support a functional definition of an impedance measurement. The specification is simplified to just specify key instance data and is not intended to be a complete measurement standard.

specifies a role of the
for the Impedance_measurement_setup_requirement. The characterized_stackup is the stackup for which the reference information is provided.

specifies a role of the
for the Impedance_measurement_setup_requirement. The measurement_stratum_1 is the
that will be evaluated with the measurement.

specifies a role of the
for the Impedance_measurement_setup_requirement. The measurement_stratum_2 is the
that will be evaluated with the measurement.

specifies a role of the
for the Impedance_measurement_setup_requirement. There shall exist one or two Stratum_technology_occurrences for the Impedance_measurement_setup_requirement.

The
shall be 'test'.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p: The measurement_stratum_1 and measurement_stratum_2 shall be disjoint from the reference_stratum.

The members of
specified by associated_stratum shall also help to compose the .

An Impedance_requirement is a type of
provided to support functional performance specification of interconnect implementations in support of high speed design. An Impedance_requirement supports specification of performance requirements for several classes of transmission line implementations.
ext_description.note: The intent of this Application Object is to support characterization of bulk measurement. This part of ISO 10303 supports specification of single ended or differential characterization in the case that the differential pair is on disjoint strata. Support for measurement of co-planar waveguide differential properties is not supported by this Application Object since detailed design data required (port locations) is not available in this part of ISO 10303.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Impedance_requirement. The frequency_range indicates the range over which the measurement results shall be valid.

specifies the role of the
for the Impedance_requirement. The impedance_value specifies the domain over which the impedance may vary and be within specification.

specifies the role of the
for the Impedance_requirement. The test_bench specifies the measurement and reference strata for the impedance measurement.

specifies the role of the
for the Impedance_requirement. The test_method specifies the procedure to be followed in the measurement process.

The . .
shall be 'test'.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Local_linear_stack is a type of
that is a locally complete vertical extent of the referenced .
ext_description.note: A collection of this Application Object can be used to describe the locally different stack models of a combined rigid-flex printed circuit board.
ext_description.example: A rigid-flex PCB where the rigid left side has 8 layers, the middle part has 3 independent stacked flex pcbs with 2 layers each (not glued together) and the rigid right side has 10 layers.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Local_linear_stack. There shall exist one or more Stratum_technology_occurrence_link for the Local_linear_stack.

The number of
in the stack shall be one greater than the number of stratum_technology_sequence.

ext_description.p:
There shall be no more than two
referencing any one member of
that are referenced by the stratum_technology_sequence.
ext_description.note: Rules 1, 2 together ensure that the stratum_technology_sequence form a directed list, and that there are no cycles in the sequence and that there are no holes in the sequence.

ext_description.p:
A Stratum_surface_technology is a type of
that specifies the surface characteristics for a .
ext_description.note: A Stratum_surface_technology is populated to support description of top/bottom orientation of materials in a stackup.
A Stratum_surface_technology\. may be used for humans to distinguish the two sides, e.g. 'shiny' and 'rough'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_surface_technology.

specifies a
that is a
to be in the role of surface_specification. There shall exist no more than one
for the Stratum_surface_technology.

Either at least one
shall be assigned to the Stratum_surface_technology or a
shall be provided.

ext_description.p:
A Stratum_technology is a type of
and a type of . A Stratum_technology is a means to provide material properties, parametric data associated with the technology, and material identification. A Stratum_technology maybe either a
or a .
ext_description.note: Technology is used in this part of ISO 10303 to indicate that some manufacturing process has been applied to a material but the details of the process are not represented.

In a design organization, a Stratum_technology is considered to be a set of requirements that the fabricator will meet. The level of detail will vary during the product design life cycle and across a supply chain. This part of ISO 10303 provides a minimal set of generic predefined data elements found useful in real designs. Additional design specific fabrication requirements are supported in other parts of ISO 10303.
ext_description.example: ISO 10303-1669 supports the ability to exchange design specific fabrication requirements related to line and land dimensions.
ext_description.note: This part of ISO 10303 does not standardize geometric models for Stratum_technology and therefore there is no reference direction provided in Stratum_technology for orientation in the x-y plane of raw material in a stackup model. The reference direction will be provided as part of current industrial practice between business entities in the supply chain.
ext_description.example: A laminate supplier indicates to a fabrication supplier that the long side of the rectangular material sheet is the reference axis for material property measurements.

ext_description.p:
specifies the role of the
for the Stratum_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Stratum_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the maximum size of any feature of the . It is defined by the diameter of the largest circle that will fit within the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the minimum spacing within or between Stratum_features of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified. Two facing arbitrary points, each of which is on the boundary of a
shall be no closer than this value.

ext_description.p: the smallest allowable ratio of Stratum_technology thickness divided by the horizontal distance that a feature side wall deviates from vertical. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: The aspect ratio is a factor in determining the expected quality of the process used to realize the feature. If the aspect ratio is large, meaning an extremely thick material in relation to its deviation from vertical at the edge, certain idealizations more accurately apply.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Stratum_technology.

specifies the
of which the Stratum_technology is a member. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the role of the
of any feature of the . It shall be possible to completely fill each
with either a square whose side length is equal to the minimum_finished_feature_size or a circle whose diameter is equal to the minimum_finished_feature_size. The minimum_finished_feature_size applies to the minimum material condition of the interconnect module as delivered to the customer. The measurement point shall be nominally at the mid point of the stratum in its vertical extent. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the
for the thickness of the Stratum_technology after manufacturing.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Stratum_technology is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Stratum_technology as its . There shall exist exactly one
for the Stratum_technology.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Stratum_technology is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Stratum_technology as its . There shall exist no more than two Stratum_surface_technologies for the Stratum_technology. If only one member of
is provided, then that member applies to both sides of a Stratum_technology. If two members of
are provided then they apply individually to the two sides of a Stratum_technology.

specifies one of the layer_position_types of the
for the Stratum_technology. Primary and secondary shall only be used if the member of Stratum_technology is a .

The
shall be unique within a population of Stratum_technologies.
If layer_position is , then Stratum_technology shall be .
If layer_position is , then Stratum_technology shall be .
The stratum_material shall be of type .
Either one or more surface_technology may be provided or a surface_specification may be provided, but surface_technology and surface_specification shall not be provided in the same model.

ext_description.p:
A Stratum_technology_mapping_relationship is a relationship between a
and a included to specify a formal relationship between a more general model and a more specific model where the more specific model includes thickness.
ext_description.note: Thickness is required for interconnect designs in order to realize real products, but footprint definitions are independent of thickness. There may be one or more populated in a design for each populated in a footprint definition.
ext_description.example: A footprint may include one for features on internal layers, while a specific design has two thicknesses of internal layers, resulting in two that are mapped to that one

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_technology_mapping_relationship.

specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_technology_mapping_relationship.

ext_description.p:
A
shall not be a target_stratum_technology.
There shall not be a cycle in the population of Stratum_technology_mapping_relationship.

A Stratum_technology_occurrence is a reference or instance of a provided for the purpose of constructing an abstract stackup model of an interconnect based solely on the technology parameters and not on any specific set of geometric properties.
ext_description.note:
The actual stackup model will be constructed using
and .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the Stratum_technology_occurrence is known.

specifies the role of the
for the Stratum_technology_occurrence.
provides parametric technology data for the Stratum_technology_occurrence.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
that is the more positive in the z direction.
ext_description.example:
A
has a matte side and a shiny side where the shiny side is designated as the top side. In the creation of a stackup model the fabricator decides to flip the material. That fact is communicated by stating that the matt side
is referenced in the primary role. In this example two members of
are populated, matte and shiny.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the angle by which the
is rotated in a stackup definition.
ext_description.example: Cloth orientation of 90 degrees with respect to a reference direction is indicated and the laminate supplier has indicated that the long side of the rectangular material sheet is the reference axis.
ext_description.note: This attribute is supporting the case where cloth orientation is required.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The name shall be unique within a population of Stratum_technology_occurrences.
A Stratum_technology_occurrence_feature_constraint is a type of .

specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_technology_occurrence_feature_constraint. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_technology_occurrence_feature_constraint. The value of this attribute need not be specified

specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_technology_occurrence_feature_constraint. The value of this attribute need not be specified

ext_description.p: The distance_unit shall be specified if and only if either difference_distance or intersection_distance is specified.

A Stratum_technology_occurrence_link is a type of
A Stratum_technology_occurrence_link is a relationship that specifies a directed link between two members of Stratum_technology_occurrence. The graph composed of a set of links for a particular stackup model is acyclic or consists of only a single loop. The link exists only in the scope of a single member of . The link forms a z-axis dimension in the stackup model. The normal usage is for the subsequent
to be more negative in the z dimension than the precedent .
ext_description.note:
While it is improbable that final design definition would include a member of Stratum_technology_occurrence_link with the
equal to the , it is possible that test data or intermediate design data in a work flow may include only one stratum in a design definition and therefore the same member of
at each end of the link, forming a loop. Therefore this part of ISO 10303 supports that configuration. That configuration is only allowed in the case of a stackup model having exactly one link.
The Stratum_technology_occurrence_link constraints only enforce an acyclic constraint on graphs composed of Stratum_technology_occurrence_link. Other constraints are contained in the .

ext_description.p:
A Passage_technology is a type of
and a type of . A Passage_technology is a description that includes material stackup parametric data related to edges and passages included in the design of layered interconnect substrates.
A Passage_technology is either a , a , or a .

A Passage_technology specifies material properties and parametric data associated with a specific manufacturing process. Different options include data for cylindrical holes, directed holes, odd shaped holes and edge treatment of substrates. Material options include specification of plating material and fill material.

The interpretation of plating and fill material is that if both are provided, the process drills, then plates, then fills. If only fill material is provided, the interpretation shall be that the process drills then fills. The interpretation of minimum_finished_size in the case of plating and fill is that minimum_finished_size applies to the plating if the minimum_finished_size is provided. Fill shall be interpreted as having no discernible passage in the delivered product. The minimum_finished_size applies to the use case where the passage is a drilled hole. The minimum_finished_feature_size applies to all cases where the passage is an edge that is not fabricated by drilling.
ext_description.note: fill and plating are process oriented properties of the model and the sequence of application is not explicitly modeled.

This part of ISO 10303 models the results of the actual plating process in two major components: passage technology and stratum technology. Sufficient detail is provided to allow applications to relate the results in the vertical domain of the passage with the horizontal domain of the stratum but there is no explicitly modeled dependency from stratum technology to the plating material in a passage technology.

ext_description.p: specifies the thickness of the plating in the final product. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the diametrical extent of the passage in the finished product. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the largest allowable ratio of passage length divided by passage diameter for the Passage_technology_parameters. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: The aspect ratio is a factor in determining the expected quality of the electroplating process in depositing metal in a passage. If the aspect ratio is large, meaning an extremely long passage in relation to its diameter, the deposition will be thinner in the central portion of the passage length than at each end of the passage. For this reason, a maximum_aspect_ratio is often determined as a factor in deciding upon the smallest passage diameters to be allowed in a PCB design. Thicker PCBs require larger minimum passage diameters, for the same expected plating quality.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the minimum diametrical extent realizable for a drilled hole for this Passage_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies whether or not the
is added to the passage for the . The value of TRUE indicates that the material is added. The value of FALSE indicates that the material is not added.

specifies the conditions required at the ends of the passage in a design where the passage meets a stratum. Note that industrial practice is to ignore the detailed physical model of the bond in order to reduce design processing resources. The practice is to treat a stratum reference differently depending on the value of this attribute. The type
includes an explicit description of the options. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Passage_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
of any feature of an edge in the design that references this technology. It shall be possible to completely fill each feature the edge helps compose with either a square whose side length is equal to the minimum_finished_feature_size or a circle whose diameter is equal to the minimum_finished_feature_size. The minimum_finished_feature_size applies to the minimum material condition of the interconnect module as delivered to the customer. The measurement point shall be nominally at the mid point of the stratum in its vertical extent. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Passage_technology. The value is the minimum remaining width of the annular ring after fabrication for the case that there is plating and that the
is on an external layer. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Passage_technology. The value is the minimum remaining width of the annular ring after fabrication for the case that there is plating and that the
is on an internal layer. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Passage_technology. The value is the minimum remaining width of the annular ring after fabrication for the case that there will not be a connection to the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Passage_technology.

specifies the role of the
for the Passage_technology. There shall be zero or one
for the Passage_technology. The
provides detailed descriptions of the steps encountered by material during fabrication.

ext_description.p:
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Passage_technology is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Passage_technology as its . There shall be zero or one
for a particular Passage_technology. The deposition_material identifies material to be plated or otherwise deposited on the passage wall.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Passage_technology is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Passage_technology as its . There shall be zero or one

ext_description.p:
The
shall be unique within a population of Passage_technology.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: If deposition_material is provided, it's type shall be .
If Passage_technology is plated, it shall have deposition_material provided.
If as_finished_deposition_thickness is provided, then deposition_material shall be provided as well.
If Passage_technology is plated, then it's deposition_material shall be electrically, magneticly, optically or thermally conductive.

ext_description.p: If the passage_terminus_condition of the Passage_technology is either a unilateral or bilateral bond, plated_passage shall be TRUE.
ext_description.note: Plating is required because plating specifies that additional material is deposited in the passage.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The as_finished_passage_extent and the minimum_finished_feature_size shall not both be provided in the same data set.

A Passage_technology_allocation_to_stack_model is a type of . A Passage_technology_allocation_to_stack_model is an assignment of a
to a specific subset of a . The subset is a contiguous, ordered subset of the vertical arrangement of
in the model.
A Passage_technology_allocation_to_stack_model assigns a plated hole with 1mm diameter to
members 1 through 6 in the .

specifies the
for the Passage_technology_allocation_to_stack_model.

specifies a role of the
for the Passage_technology_allocation_to_stack_model. The single_stratum_passage_location is provided when the passage is through exactly one
in the stackup. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Passage_technology_allocation_to_stack_model. The target_stratum provides the ability to specify a direction for asymmetrical vias. The target_stratum is one end of the passage applied to the stackup. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of a set of
for the Passage_technology_allocation_to_stack_model. The terminus_stratum are the ends of the stratum sequence in the allocated passage.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies zero or more
that specifies the Passage_technology_allocation_to_stack_model as its . The set of
together specify manufacturing tolerances for the fabrication of the specific passage technology in the context of the specific stackup model. The set may be empty with no elements provided.
If single_stratum_passage_location is provided then it shall be in ..

Either
is provided or single_stratum_passage_location , but not both shall be provided.

The number of
in the stack shall be one greater than the number of .

There shall be no more than two
referencing any one member of
that are referenced by the .
ext_description.note:
Rules 3, 4 together ensure that the
form a directed list, and that there are no cycles in the sequence and that there are no holes in the sequence.

ext_description.p: If the passage is a single stratum the target shall not be provided.
If the target_stratum is provided, then the target_stratum shall help to compose the stackup and shall be one of the terminus_stratum.
There shall be no more than one member of minimum_annular_ring provided that does not specify an .
ext_description.note:
When an
is not provided the technology applies to the entire passage technology in the context of the stackup and more than one
would be redundant.

A Stratum_technology_swap_relationship is a relationship that relates two Stratum_technologies provided to indicate that one shall replace the other .

If the primary_stratum_technology and secondary_stratum_technology are
and if the layer purpose is predefined then their
shall be the same.
ext_description.note: The purpose of this where rule is to ensure that the user does not mix different types of documentation layer technologies in a swap relationship. It is inappropriate to swap solder mask to silkscreen.

The primary_stratum_technology
shall be primary.

The secondary_stratum_technology
shall be secondary.
The primary_stratum_technology shall not be the secondary_stratum_technology.
